original_title: Over 3,000 Covid-19 victims buried at Oddamawaddi burial site: Minister
original_body_lines: Whilst revealing that some 3,634 persons who succumbed to COVID-19 were buried at the Oddamawaddi burial site during the pandemic, Minister of Health Keheliya Rambuwella told Parliament that the then government never embraced racism.

Responding to an oral question raised by MP Rauff Hakeem in the House, the Minister dismissed the allegation by the former that the government deliberately selected members of the task force appointed to look into the issue pertaining to the last rights of Covid-19 patients.
“Only one person in the task force was against the burial of those who succumbed to Covid-19. Therefore, I cannot subscribe to your allegation,” the Minister said.
It was revealed that some 2,225 men and 1,409 women were buried at Oddamawaddi which included 2,992 Muslims, 287 Buddhists, 270 Hindus and 85 Catholics. (Yohan Perera and Ajith Siriwardana)
